spatial_accuracy.notes: Overall macro-zoning roughly matches (garage right, living/kitchen central-right, alfresco top-right, bedroom wing left/top-left), but many plan-critical details deviate. Several internal partitions/closet recesses from the 2D plan are not modeled, door locations are simplified/shifted, and window placement does not follow the plan’s distributed openings. Room proportions also drift (notably the entry/porch zone and some service-room depths), reducing plan-to-render traceability.

structural_fidelity.notes: Wall thickness and embedded openings are inconsistently represented (many plan doors appear as open passages; closets/recesses largely omitted). Adjacencies are mostly plausible at a high level, but the plan’s finer-grain structure (robes, WIL/linen, recesses, WC separations) is not faithfully preserved, creating functional layout mismatches despite a similar outer footprint.

furniture_mapping.notes: Furniture is placed in the general intended zones (beds in bedrooms, couches in living/activity/theatre areas, dining near kitchen, outdoor furniture in alfresco), but it does not reliably map to the specific rooms/uses in the 2D plan (e.g., theatre vs activity furnishing ambiguity). Scale is broadly believable, though several rooms read as under/over-furnished relative to their plan sizes.

aesthetic_quality.notes: Clean, readable isometric render with good lighting and coherent materials. Camera is consistent with an isometric-like viewpoint (slight perspective). Geometry is mostly clean with minimal artifacts. However, the render prioritizes visual staging over plan-accurate architectural detailing (doors/windows/closet carcasses), reducing orthographic fidelity.

detected_errors.description: Multiple door locations do not match the 2D plan; several planned hinged doors are shown as open passages or shifted openings (notably around the central hall/entry transitions).
Door orientation/swing fidelity is not preserved; the 3D render largely omits swing behavior and replaces it with non-door openings in several locations.
Entry/portico interface is simplified; the plan’s defined ENTRY/PORTICO geometry and thresholds are not represented with the same boundaries/opening placement.
Built-in storage elements from the plan (multiple ROBE recesses, WIL, and LINEN) are largely missing as distinct enclosed compartments.
Service core layout (BATH/WC/LAUNDRY cluster) is not partitioned/door-defined as clearly as in the plan; separations appear reduced or reconfigured.
Window placement around the perimeter does not match the plan’s specific window segments; several elevations show continuous or differently positioned openings compared to the 2D layout.
Proportion drift: the entry/hall and some adjacent rooms read with altered depth/width compared to the plan, affecting circulation proportions.
Theatre vs Activity definition is ambiguous in the 3D render; furnishing and partition cues do not cleanly match the plan’s distinct THEATRE and ACTIVITY rooms.
Verandah is not clearly modeled as a distinct front outdoor zone matching the plan’s labeled VERANDAH footprint (appears reduced/merged with generic front slab).
Hallucinated interior staging elements (e.g., some freestanding consoles/islands/bench-like pieces) appear where the 2D plan indicates recesses/doors/closets rather than open furniture placements.
